gameplay

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the bulk of the actions available in the game.
    It sets up the game, and provides a layer of access to the game components for the controller.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Team 10 - SOEN6441

      Returns the total number of areas controlled by the given player.
      An area is controlled by a player if (s)he "has more playing pieces in it than any single other player (a playing piece being a minion or a building) and has more pieces than the total number of trolls in the area".
      An area that has at least one demon cannot be controlled.

      • getPlayersFromCurrentPlayer

        public Color[] getPlayersFromCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:
        a shifted view of the players' order so that it starts with the player whose turn it currently is. This is useful in cases where, for example, a random event happens and each player has to perform an action in sequence.

        For example, if the Blue player is playing and the original order is Red -> Blue -> Green -> Yellow, the view returned is Blue -> Green -> Yellow.

      • restorePlayerHand

        public void restorePlayerHand(Player p)
        Brings the given player's hand size back to 5 if it is less than that.
        If no more player cards are available, the player's hand is left as it is at the time when the cards are up (the game should end after the player's turn is finished).
        Parameters:
        p - the player whose hand size must be restored.

      • addPlayerCard

        public boolean addPlayerCard(Player p,
                             int i)
        Draws player cards.
        Adds the given player's hand size (i) if it is less than five.
        If no more player cards are available, the player's hand is left as it is at the time when the cards are up (the game should end after the player's turn is finished).
        Parameters:
        p - the player whose hand size must be restored.

        public void handleSubsidence()

      • placeDemon

        public boolean placeDemon(int areaID)
        Place a demon to the area with the given ID. Also, the City Area card corresponding to that area is disabled (it will only be enabled again if the demon is removed).
        Parameters:
        areaID -
        Returns:
        true if the demon was placed successfully, false otherwise.

      • removeDemon

        public boolean removeDemon(int areaID)
        Removes (i.e. assassinates :-) a demon from the area with the given area code. If this was the last demon in the area, the corresponding city area card should become active again (if it is owned by any player who has a building in that area).
        Parameters:
        areaID -
        Returns:
        true if the demon was removed successfully, false otherwise.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • finishGameOnPoints

        public java.util.List<Player> finishGameOnPoints(boolean checkForEmptyDeck)
        Finishes the game on points either due to not having any player cards left on the draw pile or because of Riots.
        Parameters:
        checkForEmptyDeck -
        Returns:
        a list containing one or multiple winners. If there are still cards on the draw pile, an empty list is returned.

      • getWinnersByPoints

        public java.util.List<Player> getWinnersByPoints()
        Figures out which player has won based on the total number of points:
        - Each minion on the board is worth five points.
        - Each building is worth a number of points equal to its monetary cost. Each $1 in hand is worth one point.
        - If you have the Dent card or the Bank card then you must pay back the amount noted on the card.
        - If you cannot do so then you lose fifteen points each.
        - In the case of a tie the tied player with the highest monetary value City Area card is the winner.
        - If there is still a tie then the tied players shared the honours of a joint win.
        The game is declared finished after that.
        Returns:
        the player(s) who won the game based on points.

      • getPlayerPoints

        public int getPlayerPoints(Player p)
        Retrieves the total number of points for the given player.
        - Each minion on the board (on areas which are not occupied by demons) is worth five points.
        - Each building is worth a number of points equal to its monetary cost unless there is a demon in the area. - Each $1 in hand is worth one point.
        - If you have the Mr. Bent card or the Bank card then you must pay back the amount noted on the card.
        - If you cannot do so then you lose fifteen points for each such card.
        Returns:
        the number of points for the given player.

      • getPlayerNetWorth

        public int getPlayerNetWorth(Player p)
        Returns:
        the given player's net worth (cash plus the monetary cost of each owned building in demon-free areas - loans taken out * $12)

        public void removePlayerCard(GreenPlayerCard card,
                             Player p)
        Remove the given player card from the given player's hand. Similar to discardCard(GreenPlayerCard, Player) but doesn't add the card to the pile discard. Ideal for giving a card to another player.

        p -

                           Player affectedPlayer,

        Parameters:

        affectedPlayer - Player that may be able to play interrupt card
        interrupt - Interrupt that was signaled from elsewhere
        searchInterrupt - Interrupt that if found allows some change to take place
        played - If a previous interrupt has been played in this turn
        Returns:
